TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit KeyChain extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The KeyChain class provides access to private keys and their corresponding certificate chains in credential storage.

MemberSignature.Value: static member ChoosePrivateKeyAlias : Android.App.Activity * Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback * string[] * Java.Security.IPrincipal[] * Android.Net.Uri * string -> unit

public static void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias (Android.App.Activity activity, Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[]? keyTypes, Java.Security.IPrincipal[]? issuers, Android.Net.Uri? uri, string? alias);

.method public static hidebysig void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias(class Android.App.Activity activity, class Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[] keyTypes, class Java.Security.IPrincipal[] issuers, class Android.Net.Uri uri, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: The Activity context to use for launching the new sub-Activity to prompt the user to select a private key; used only to call startActivity(); must not be null.
Callback to invoke when the request completes; must not be null.
The acceptable types of asymmetric keys such as "RSA", "EC" or null.
The acceptable certificate issuers for the certificate matching the private key, or null.
The full URI the server is requesting the certificate for, or null if unavailable.
The alias to preselect if available, or null if unavailable.
Docs.summary: Launches an Activity for the user to select the alias for a private key and certificate pair for authentication.

format.a: Java documentation for android.security.KeyChain.choosePrivateKeyAlias(android.app.Activity, android.security.KeyChainAliasCallback, java.lang.String[], java.security.Principal[], android.net.Uri, java.lang.String).

MemberSignature.Value: static member ChoosePrivateKeyAlias : Android.App.Activity * Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback * string[] * Java.Security.IPrincipal[] * string * int * string -> unit
MemberSignature.Usage: Android.Security.KeyChain.ChoosePrivateKeyAlias (activity, response, keyTypes, issuers, host, port, alias)

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias (Android.App.Activity activity, Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[]? keyTypes, Java.Security.IPrincipal[]? issuers, string? host, int port, string? alias);

.method public static hidebysig void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias(class Android.App.Activity activity, class Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[] keyTypes, class Java.Security.IPrincipal[] issuers, string host, int32 port, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: The host name of the server requesting the certificate, or null if unavailable.
The port number of the server requesting the certificate, or -1 if unavailable.
The Activity context to use for launching the new sub-Activity to prompt the user to select a private key; used only to call startActivity(); must not be null.
Callback to invoke when the request completes; must not be null.
The acceptable types of asymmetric keys such as "RSA", "EC" or null.
The acceptable certificate issuers for the certificate matching the private key, or null.
The full URI the server is requesting the certificate for, or null if unavailable.
The alias to preselect if available, or null if unavailable.
Docs.summary: Launches an Activity for the user to select the alias for a private key and certificate pair for authentication.

format.a: Java documentation for android.security.KeyChain.choosePrivateKeyAlias(android.app.Activity, android.security.KeyChainAliasCallback, java.lang.String[], java.security.Principal[], android.net.Uri, java.lang.String).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Content.Intent CreateManageCredentialsIntent(class Android.Security.AppUriAuthenticationPolicy policy) cil managed

Docs.param: The authentication policy determines which alias for a private key and certificate pair should be used for authentication.
Docs.summary: Returns an Intent that should be used by an app to request to manage the user's credentials.

MemberSignature.Value: static member GetCertificateChain : Android.Content.Context * string -> Java.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[]
public static Java.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[]? GetCertificateChain (Android.Content.Context context, string alias);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[] GetCertificateChain(class Android.Content.Context context, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
The alias of the desired certificate chain, typically returned via KeyChainAliasCallback#alias.
Docs.summary: Returns the X509Certificate chain for the requested alias, or null if the alias does not exist or the caller has no permission to access it (see note on exceptions in #getPrivateKey).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the alias was valid but there was some problem accessing it.
if called from the main thread.

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Security.IPrivateKey GetPrivateKey(class Android.Content.Context context, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
The alias of the desired private key, typically returned via KeyChainAliasCallback#alias.

if called from the main thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool RemoveCredentialManagementApp(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Called by the credential management app CredentialManagementApp to unregister as the credential management app and stop managing the user's credentials.
Docs.returns: true if the credential management app was successfully removed.
